keyMoments.title: Discovery of Salt Weakness (Flashback)
keyMoments.description: In a flashback to five years ago, Brook discovers that salt is the weakness of Thriller Bark's zombies after witnessing a zombie pass out from eating grilled fish with salt and observing Hogback's reaction.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals how Brook learned the crucial zombie weakness and establishes his observational skills and strategic thinking.
keyMoments.quote: There's no way it could be the salt... but the way Hogback reacted...

keyMoments.title: Origin of 'Humming Brook' Epithet
keyMoments.description: The flashback reveals Brook developed his humming technique as a way to manage his fear while purifying zombies with salt, singing to himself so he wouldn't see their frightening faces.
keyMoments.significance: Provides character depth showing Brook's vulnerability and how he overcame his fear through music.

keyMoments.title: First Defeat by Ryuma and the Afro Plea
keyMoments.description: Flashback shows Brook's first encounter with Ryuma five years ago, where he desperately begged for his life and the preservation of his afro, explaining it would never grow back. Ryuma spared him but made him promise never to return.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Brook's character growth - from someone who begged for mercy to someone willing to fight to the death for his promise.
keyMoments.quote: Please spare my afro! If you cut it off, it will never grow back!

keyMoments.title: The Afro's Connection to Laboon
keyMoments.description: Brook reveals that his afro is his last physical connection to his human appearance and the feature that will allow Laboon to recognize him when they reunite.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the emotional weight of Brook's afro beyond aesthetics - it represents his promise and hope.

keyMoments.title: Declaration of Unwavering Resolve
keyMoments.description: Brook firmly declares to Ryuma that he will never give up until he reclaims his shadow, showing the strength of his conviction to retrieve his shadow and return to Laboon.
keyMoments.significance: Pivotal character moment demonstrating Brook's transformation from coward to determined warrior.
keyMoments.quote: I will never give up until I reclaim what I have lost!

keyMoments.title: Claiming Ownership of His Shadow
keyMoments.description: Brook asserts that Ryuma is his shadow, not the other way around, and declares he will fight to return the shadow to its rightful position under his feet.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Brook's philosophical understanding that he is the true owner of the shadow's abilities.
keyMoments.quote: You are my shadow. I will fight to return you to your rightful position - under my feet!

reveals.information: Brook discovered zombies' weakness to salt five years ago by observation
Brook developed humming technique to cope with fear while purifying zombies
Brook was defeated by Ryuma five years ago and begged for his life to preserve his afro

keyMoments.title: First Battle with Brook (Flashback)
keyMoments.description: Flashback shows Ryuma's encounter with Brook five years ago, where he threatened to cut off Brook's afro but ultimately spared him after Brook begged for mercy.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Ryuma's past interaction with Brook and shows he's not purely evil despite being a zombie.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Status as Legendary Dragon-Slaying Samurai
keyMoments.description: Ryuma states he is a legendary dragon-slaying swordsman and asserts that the level of their bodies are fundamentally different, with his legendary warrior corpse being superior to Brook's skeleton.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Ryuma's legendary background and hints at his connection to Wano Country lore.
keyMoments.quote: I am a legendary dragon-slaying swordsman. The level of our bodies is different.

reveals.information: Legendary dragon-slaying samurai from Wano Country
Previously encountered and defeated Brook five years ago on Thriller Bark

keyMoments.title: Displays Luffy's Massive Appetite
keyMoments.description: Oars devours massive quantities of food with an insatiable appetite, threatening to deplete Thriller Bark's entire food supply, perfectly mirroring Luffy's eating habits.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the complete personality transfer from Luffy's shadow to Oars.

keyMoments.title: Attempts Gomu Gomu no Pistol
keyMoments.description: Oars refuses to serve Moria and attempts to use 'Gomu Gomu no Pistol,' punching through the freezer wall with tremendous force, though his arm doesn't actually stretch.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Oars has inherited Luffy's muscle memory and techniques despite lacking the Devil Fruit powers.

keyMoments.title: Declares Dream to Become Pirate King
keyMoments.description: Oars loudly declares his ambition to become the King of the Pirates, directly echoing Luffy's lifelong dream and shocking the Thriller Bark inhabitants.
keyMoments.significance: Confirms Oars has fully inherited Luffy's core personality trait and dream.
keyMoments.quote: I'm gonna be King of the Pirates!

reveals.information: Inherited Luffy's personality, dreams, and muscle memory for techniques
Refuses to serve Moria, wants to explore and become Pirate King
